intro: Gibbesia rugelii, commonly known as the roughleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Gibbesia rugelii is adapted to wet environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
